intro: Hesperis thessala, commonly known as the Greek candytuft, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with distinctive four-petaled flowers. The plant produces clusters of white or pale pink flowers that bloom in early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Hesperis thessala is valued for its ornamental beauty and is often cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance.
